posts.content: üéØ How to run a War Room when your ideas are going nuclear? Here's my chaotic scoring framework (because spreadsheets are too mainstream)

image.alt: Chaos by Design or Designed by Chaos

posts.content: Complexity (0-5): From "rebuilding Twitter alone in a weekend" to "Hello World with extra glitter". Like difficulty settings, but for your sanity!
Scope (0-5): Ranges from "needs an army of pre-layoff Twitter devs" to "can code it blindfolded during lunch break". It's all about knowing your limits (or not).
Alignment (0-5): From "why did I think this was a good idea?" to "SHUT UP AND TAKE MY TIME!". Because sometimes your best ideas are your worst enemies.
Pleasure (0-5): Scale goes from "debugging in prod on Friday night" to "building your own theme park with blackjack and unit tests". Fun should be a feature!
Mix them all together, add some public voting (because democracy in chaos is fun), and BOOM - you've got yourself a decision!
